title: Why is there a recurring motif in Marvin Gaye's 1970 album What's Going On? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yep. The world not changing for the better. Marvin on this album for many urban people along with Curtis Mayfield and few yrs later Stevie Wonder, became the voice of social injustice. He showed them thier voices of how people of color were being treated at time we're not unheard. and on What's Going On the motif or pattern recurs throughout this timeless collection of songs
Marvin was concerned about all of the issues he saw occurring in the world. The Vietnam war, environmental, social and racial unrest, were all on his mind. This album was his catharsis.
